thread.title: Cowboys fan Jordan Spieth gets pranked by his caddie while winning Tour Championship
thread.title_full: Cowboys fan Jordan Spieth gets pranked by his caddie while winning Tour Championship | Dallas Morning News

author: SportsDayDFW.com
title: Cowboys fan Jordan Spieth gets pranked by his caddie while winning Tour Championship
text:
Jordan Spieth counts on his caddie, Michael Greller, for a lot of things ... mainly help in continuing to be one of the most dominant players on the PGA Tour.
But if Spieth is counting on Greller for updates on how his Dallas Cowboys are doing on Sundays, perhaps the current Masters and U.S. Open champion should just rely on the internet.
Seems Greller decided to have some fun with Spieth on Sunday. While Spieth was busy winning the Tour Championship and the FedEx Cup playoffs, his favorite team was tussling with the Atlanta Falcons at AT&T Stadium.
With Spieth at the 17th tee on Sunday, Greller decided to give him some "great" news concerning the Cowboys.
ESPN's Jason Sobel tweeted: Standing on 17th tee, Greller told Spieth, "Hey, the Cowboys won today." Spieth got excited, then Greller laughed, "No, I have no idea."
Standing on 17th tee, Greller told Spieth, "Hey, the Cowboys won today." Spieth got excited, then Greller laughed, "No, I have no idea."
â” Jason Sobel (@JasonSobelESPN) September 27, 2015 Probably a good thing. A real update might have been disturbing for Spieth. Atlanta won 39-28.
